He advises investors to carefully select IPOs and focus on rate-sensitive sectors, IT, capital markets, and bullion, while avoiding overvalued capital goods, railways, and defense stocks.

items.title: Wockhardt shares zoom 20% after USFDA’s historic approval for antibiotic drug Zaynich
items.summary: The US FDA has accepted Wockhardt’s New Drug Application for Zaynich, its first-in-class antibiotic. This marks the first-ever acceptance of an NDA for a New Chemical Entity from an Indian pharma company, representing a major regulatory breakthrough.

items.title: Auto Sales November 2025: Sales surge across segments after GST overhaul; M&M total sales up 19%, Bajaj Auto up 8%
items.summary: Auto Sales November 2025: November 2025 has been recorded as a month in which vehicle sales across various categories performed very well. This strong performance has continued since the implementation of lower GST rates on vehicles this Navratri. Check details:

items.title: Nithin Kamath recalls how a Bengaluru airport conversation led to 10 years of zero brokerage at Zerodha
items.summary: Nithin Kamath recounted how the decision was taken in November 2015 during a conversation with co-founder and CTO Kailash Nadh at Bengaluru airport, on their way to Kochi. The brokerage had just launched its trading platform Kite and was looking to shed its image of being only for active traders.

items.title: ICICI Prudential Life posts 99.33% claim settlement ratio in H1FY26
items.summary: The insurer achieved an average turnaround time of 1.1 days for non-investigated claims;The company settled death claims worth ₹893.38 crore in the first half of FY26

items.title: India seeks Lok Sabha nod for ₹41,455 crore additional spending in FY26
items.summary: The government is seeking Parliament's approval for a net additional spending of Rs 41,455 crore in the current fiscal. This includes over Rs 18,000 crore for fertiliser subsidies and approximately Rs 9,500 crore for oil marketing companies. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman presented the Supplementary Demands for Grants in the Lok Sabha.

items.title: Bulls booking profits after taking Sensex & Nifty to fresh peaks? Anil Singhvi decodes key levels
items.summary: Stock Market Today: At 2:12 PM, the BSE Sensex was at 85,736.53, up 29.86 points or 0.03 per cent. The index opened higher at 86,065.92, touched an intraday high of 86,159.02, and fell to a low of 85,550.74.

items.title: Samsung, LG lead global premium TV market in Q3 despite rising Chinese competition
items.summary: Samsung and LG Electronics maintained their dominance in the global premium TV market during Q3, driven by high-end and OLED segments. However, Chinese manufacturers like TCL and Hisense are gaining ground in overall shipments amidst a shrinking global TV market and a rise in budget-friendly models.

items.title: Govt simplifies approval process for exploration of coal, lignite
items.summary: The Coal Ministry has streamlined the approval process for coal and lignite exploration. This reform aims to improve business ease and promote efficient, sustainable resource exploration. The new system bypasses the need for government panel approval.

items.title: Agrochemical industry set for recovery as exports bounce back after two years: Crisil
items.summary: Indian agrochemical industry revenue is projected to grow 6-7% this fiscal, driven by a rebound in exports due to improved global demand and normalized inventories. Domestic offtake is slowing due to a protracted monsoon. The industry's return to its long-term growth range of 8-10% next fiscal depends on sustained export momentum and domestic demand recovery.

items.title: Rate-sensitive sectors poised to drive next leg of earnings growth in FY26: Manish Sonthalia
items.summary: Indian equity markets have reached a new peak after a long wait. However, this record high does not reflect the entire market. Midcap and smallcap stocks are still lagging behind. Liquidity issues, driven by a surge in IPOs, are impacting these segments. Experts anticipate rate-sensitive sectors to drive future growth as India moves towards a lower interest rate cycle.

items.title: Europeans Tally Huge Costs of China’s Controls on Critical Goods
items.summary: Chinese export controls are forcing European companies to rethink how they operate, according to a survey, after piling on additional costs that could exceed €250 million ($290 million) in the case of one firm.

items.title: Calm in the time of chaos: How this zillennial made landlines look cool again, making $120,000 sales in 3 days
items.summary: In July 2025, two years after building the customised landline, Cat Goetze unveiled her landline device to her online audience to check if they thought it was a good idea. What happened next was unexpected.

items.title: Govt seeks Parliament nod for fresh expenditure of over ₹41,500 crore
items.summary: The first Supplementary Demands for Grants include boosts to fund fertilizer subsidies, LPG under-recoveries

items.title: After record sales in October, vehicle makers report monthly decline in November sales
items.summary: in terms of year-on-year (Y-o-Y) sales, most of the original equipment manufacturers (OEMs) reported growth in the domestic wholesales including M&M, that grew by 22 per cent at 56,336 units as compared with 46,222 units in November 2024

items.title: Vinay Rajani of HDFC Securities suggests these stocks to buy for short-term
items.summary: The domestic stock market opened strong with Nifty 50 at a record high of 26,325.80, driven by positive GDP data. However, indices traded flat later in the day, with potential for a 25 basis points rate cut from RBI amidst bullish trends in Nifty 50 and Bank Nifty.

items.title: Apple case: Delhi High Court gives govt and CCI a week to justify fines based on global turnover
items.summary: However, the court declined to pass any order on the CCI’s request that Apple be directed to submit its financial details by 8 December. It also did not comment on Apple’s plea seeking protection from potential coercive steps by the regulator.

items.title: Meesho, Aequs & Vidya Wires IPOs open this week. GMP indicates up to 35% listing gains
items.summary: Three mainboard IPOs — Meesho, Aequs, and Vidya Wires — open this week with strong grey market premiums indicating potential listing gains of 17–35%. Meesho and Aequs lead with over 30% GMP, while Vidya Wires also shows solid investor interest despite its smaller issue size.

items.title: Dani Rodrik: How should the world respond to China’s growing export dominance?
items.summary: China’s export juggernaut has triggered calls for tariffs and reshoring, but these are suboptimal responses. Policymakers have better ways to safeguard jobs and advanced manufacturing while pursuing national security objectives. Here’s what would serve their aims better.

items.title: India’s manufacturing activity eases to a nine-month low in November as export orders slow
items.summary: New export orders PMI fell to a 13-month low and business confidence, as indicated by expectations for future output, also showed a big fall in November

items.title: Market outlook: Dalal Street is gearing up for an upswing in 2026 — Here's why
items.summary: Earnings upgrades are anticipated from Q3 onwards, driven by tax reforms, favourable monsoon conditions, moderated inflation, and accommodative monetary policy. This optimism extends into 2026, as global and domestic risks are expected to moderate.

items.title: Ola Electric vs Hero MotoCorp: Who’s winning EV race? Here's what investors should know
items.summary: Ola Electric vs Hero MotoCorp: Ola Electric has struggled post-IPO, while Hero MotoCorp has overtaken it in sales and delivered steady stock gains, highlighting contrasting risk and upside potential for investors.

items.title: Tobacco Levy Alert: Finance Minister tables dual bills in Lok Sabha
items.summary: The Winter Session agenda includes 13 Bills, several of which have not undergone scrutiny by a Standing Committee.

items.title: India's power consumption dips to 123.4 billion units in November
items.summary: India's power consumption saw a slight dip of 0.31% in November, totaling 123.4 billion units, attributed to reduced use of cooling appliances and the onset of winter. Despite this, peak power demand increased to 215.54 GW. Consumption is expected to stabilize from December with increased heating appliance usage.

items.title: Wockhardt share price jumps over 19% after US FDA accepts new drug application for Zaynich
items.summary: Wockhardt's shares jumped 19.3% to  ₹1,473 following the US FDA's acceptance of its antibiotic drug Zaynich's New Drug Application. The pharma shares have remained under pressure since hitting a one-year high in July 2025 and have so far lost 22% of their value.

items.title: Temasek-backed Atomberg is said to plan $200 Million India IPO
items.summary: Atomberg is among a growing number of companies seeking to tap India’s buoyant IPO market, where firms have raised about $19.6 billion so far this year, following a record $21 billion in 2024

items.title: Airbus says most A320 jets affected by recall now modified
items.summary: Airbus said it was working with airline customers to support modifications on the remaining aircraft to return them to service

items.title: Ravelcare IPO Day 1: Check GMP, subscription status, key dates, and other details - What to know before subscribing
items.summary: Ravelcare's IPO opened for subscription on December 1, raising  ₹24.10 crore. The price band is  ₹123-130 per share. The IPO was subscribed 6x on Day 1, with strong investor interest indicated by a grey market premium of  ₹52.

items.title: Euro zone yields edge up, ultra-long end of German curve steepens
items.summary: Euro area government bond yields edged up on Monday as investors looked to U.S. Treasuries for direction, while the ultra-long end of the German curve hovered near its steepest levels in over six years.

items.title: Parliament panels get more time to submit reports on insolvency, Jan Vishwas provisions bills
items.summary: Lok Sabha extends deadlines for two select committees to submit reports on the Insolvency & Bankruptcy Code (Amendment) Bill 2025 and Jan Vishwas (Amendment of Provisions) Bill 2025. The insolvency bill proposes out-of-court, group, and cross-border frameworks, while the Jan Vishwas bill aims to decriminalise 288 minor offences to promote ease of living and improve the business climate.

items.title: Japanese property giants deepen their push into a booming Indian market
items.summary: Japanese real estate developers are wading further into a tricky Indian market and more of their peers are expected to get their feet wet, drawn by rising rents in a rapidly growing economy as well as low construction costs.

items.title: India achieved ethanol blending of 19.2% during ESY 2024-25
items.summary: OMCs achieved the target of 10 per cent ethanol blending in petrol in June 2022, which was five months ahead of the target during ESY 2021-22

items.title: Why do 30% term life insurance applications get rejected in India? Explained
items.summary: While many people usually fear the rejection of their insurance claims, this analysis shows that many people cannot even get the term policy in the first place — as almost one in three applications are rejected during underwriting, which is the insurer’s evaluation stage.

items.title: Paytm share price hits 52-week high; Should you buy, sell or hold the stock
items.summary: Shares of One97 Communications rise over 3 per cent as RBI grants final license to Paytm Payments Services, enabling merchant onboarding. Goldman Sachs and ICICI Securities upgrade stock; check price target.

items.title: Emerging Stocks, Currencies Edge Higher as Traders Await US Data
items.summary: Emerging-market stocks edged up Monday, with currencies steady as bets on a December rate cut by the Federal Reserve held firm.

items.title: Silver prices zoom 85% YTD to record high above  ₹1.78 lakh, outshine gold price. Will the rally extend to 2026?
items.summary: MCX gold price has delivered returns of 60% so far in 2025, while MCX silver price has significantly outperformed, rallying 85% on a YTD basis. Over the past three months alone, gold prices have gained 25%, compared with a more than 40% spike in silver rates.

items.title: Sensex, Nifty slip from record highs; Kotak Mahindra, Adani Ports among lead gainers
items.summary: While fundamentals remain supportive, these near-term concerns prompted traders to pare positions, pulling the Sensex and Nifty back from record levels

items.title: ATF price hiked by 5.4%, commercial LPG rates cut
items.summary: Indian Oil Corporation, Bharat Petroleum and Hindustan Petroleum revise Aviation Turbine Fuel and Liquefied Petroleum Gas prices on the first day of every month based on international benchmarks and the exchange rate

items.title: Apple's $38 billion dilemma: Delhi HC hears tech giant's appeal against antitrust agency; what's at stake?
items.summary: Apple filed a petition at the Delhi High Court, saying that the change puts at stake $38 billion, or 10% of its global turnover, if the provision is implemented on its ongoing case with the regulator regarding the App Store antitrust probe.

items.title: SBI expects RBI to hold rates in December, turns bullish on Nifty 500 stocks
items.summary: State Bank of India expects the Reserve Bank of India to hold interest rates steady in light of robust Q2 GDP growth and low inflation. SBI finds concentration risk on the rise in the S&amp;P 500, but the Nifty 500 looks better represented due to the representation of diverse sectors.

items.title: Why smallcap index fell almost 3% in November despite Nifty hitting record highs; should you still buy?
items.summary: November's Indian stock market saw large-caps rise while small-caps fell, driven by high valuations and lackluster earnings. Continued FII selling affected small-caps, but experts believe the correction may create opportunities for long-term investors looking to enter the market.

items.title: Smallcaps still overvalued, midcaps lead earnings momentum: Nischal Maheshwari
items.summary: India's robust GDP growth fuels expectations of an RBI interest rate cut, with experts citing favorable macro conditions. Despite strong real GDP, nominal growth remains a concern, prompting calls for immediate easing. Equity markets show uneven breadth, with midcaps outperforming lagging smallcaps. The banking sector is poised for a strong phase, while IPO valuations remain stretched despite improving profitability.

items.title: Markets slip after opening at record highs, Bank Nifty holds above 60,000
items.summary: Market breadth negative with 2,238 stocks declining, against 1,795 advancing on the BSE

items.title: Silver hits all-time high at Rs 1,78,649 per kg, gold rises to Rs 1,30,550/10g on Fed rate-cut hopes
items.summary: Bullion markets surged as silver and gold futures rose to record levels in domestic trade, supported by a weaker US dollar and growing anticipation of a U.S. Federal Reserve interest rate cut. Investors are also eyeing key U.S. economic data for further cues.

items.title: Toyota Kirloskar Motor sales rise by 28% in Nov to 33,752 units
items.summary: Toyota Kirloskar Motor reported a significant 28 percent increase in total dispatches to dealers for November. The company sent 33,752 units to dealerships, a notable rise compared to the previous year. This growth reflects strong market momentum following a positive festive season. New editions of popular models like the Urban Cruiser Hyryder and Fortuner are contributing to this upward trend.

items.title: Bombay HC upholds Sebi approval for WeWork India IPO, fines petitioner  ₹100,000
items.summary: The Bombay high court on 1 December upheld market regulator Sebi's approval for WeWork India's IPO, dismissing two petitions that challenged the listing. One petitioner was also ordered to pay  ₹1 lakh legal costs.

items.title: Aviation Turbine Fuel price hiked by 5.4%, commercial LPG rates cut
items.summary: ATF prices in Delhi increased by ₹5,133.75 per kilolitre to ₹99,676.77 per kl, marking the third consecutive monthly hike, according to state-owned fuel retailers

items.title: ITPL opens greenfield bitumen derivatives plant near Chennai
items.summary: IndianOil Total Pvt Ltd (ITPL) has inaugurated a new greenfield Bitumen Derivatives Plant in Gummidipoondi, near Chennai. This facility will produce various forms of bitumen, including Polymer Modified Bitumen and Crumb Rubber Modified Bitumen, to support road construction projects across southern India. The plant aims to enhance supply chain efficiency and provide high-performance materials engineered for local conditions.

items.title: FIIs returning, DIIs rotating: Sunil Subramaniam says mid & smallcaps poised for a comeback
items.summary: Sunil Subramaniam sees a shift in market leadership, with DIIs poised to rotate toward midcaps, smallcaps, and lagging sectors. FIIs may accelerate inflows on improving earnings and attractive relative valuations. He expects a revival in private capex, strong prospects in industrials and PSU banks, and a potential boost from the upcoming Budget through incentives and PPP-driven projects.

items.title: Air India takes another step to fortify China route
items.summary: Air India is expanding its reach in China. The airline has appointed The Aviation Management Limited as its General Sales Agent for passenger sales. This partnership begins on December 1, 2025. Air India will also resume flights to Shanghai from February 1, 2026. New routes to Shanghai are planned for 2026.

items.title: 12 Multibaggers: FIIs and MFs-backed stocks deliver over 25% gains in both quarters of FY26
items.summary: The report highlights 21 high-performing Indian stocks in FY26 with over 25% gains in the first two quarters, attracting strong FII and MF investments. Twelve stocks have more than doubled, while eight gained 66–99%. Key performers include Cupid, Rossell Techsys, Lumax Industries, and Tilaknagar Industries, with details on quarterly gains and institutional holdings.

items.title: Mint Explainer | GDP at 8.2%, fiscal deficit rising: What it means for the Indian economy
items.summary: India’s latest data shows a sharp growth surprise alongside mounting fiscal pressures, offering a mixed picture of the economy’s underlying momentum.

items.title: Commercial LPG prices cut by ₹10; ATF rates hiked for third month in a row
items.summary: Commercial LPG cylinder prices saw a ₹10 per unit reduction, bringing the 19-kg cylinder to ₹1,580.50 in Delhi. This follows a previous decrease, offering relief to the hospitality sector. However, Aviation Turbine Fuel (ATF) prices rose by 5.4% for the third consecutive month, increasing costs for airlines.

items.title: Ola Electric launches pan-India in-app service appointment under Hyperservice initiative
items.summary: Ola Electric has launched an in-app service appointment feature nationwide as part of its Hyperservice initiative. This allows customers to easily schedule vehicle servicing, track status, and manage all service needs within the Ola Electric app. The company aims to enhance transparency, convenience, and customer trust in EV servicing.

items.title: Domestic market valuations cool but remain elevated, earnings recovery seen as key driver: Equirus Securities
items.summary: Risk-reward favours large caps and quality compounders where valuations are closer to historical bands, while mid/small caps remain vulnerable to any earnings disappointment

items.title: Airtel logs sharp subscriber jump in October; Jio growth slows, Vi loses over 20 lakh users — TRAI data
items.summary: TRAI Data: October brought a clear divergence in performance among telecom operators. Airtel staged a strong recovery with its best monthly additions since February, while Jio’s growth moderated sharply. Vodafone Idea saw another deep subscriber loss, extending its multi-month decline. BSNL posted meaningful gains as it pushes ahead with its 4G expansion. Industry-wide subscriber growth, however, slowed markedly to just 14 lakh, pointing to a more mature, churn-driven market.

items.title: Elon Musk's top 5 moments on Nikhil Kamath's WTF podcast: ‘Evil’ AI, investments, and big shout-out to Indians in US
items.summary: Elon Musk had an extensive conversation on Nikhil Kamath's WTF Podcast. Here are the top five moments from the interview

items.title: Hindustan Zinc shares gain 3% as silver surge lifts sentiment; up for fifth day
items.summary: Hindustan Zinc shares rose on Monday, marking a fifth consecutive day of gains, driven by record-high silver prices and robust investor interest. As India’s sole listed silver producer, the company stands to benefit from industrial demand, Fed rate cut expectations, and untapped valuation potential relative to global peers.

items.title: Kia Seltos 2025 facelift teaser released: Check pictures, video, what’s new, launch date, and key upgrades
items.summary: Kia has revealed the first teaser for the upcoming Seltos facelift, showcasing significant exterior and interior revisions. The refreshed SUV, set for an India debut on December 10, 2025, will feature a redesigned front, a panoramic sunroof, and a modern triple-screen setup inside.  Engine options remain, with a potential hybrid variant also on the cards.

items.title: Delhi-NCR Air Pollution Update: AQI crosses 310, capital breathes slightly easier, but still remains in the ‘very poor’ category
items.summary: Delhi’s air quality remained lodged in the ‘very poor’ category on Monday. According to the data from Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB), the Air Quality Index (AQI) touching 299 at 7 am and rising further past the 320-mark in some parts of Delhi-NCR by the afternoon.

items.title: Meesho's losses cast a shadow on its IPO. Should investors be worried about the earnings future?
items.summary: Meesho, India's largest e-commerce platform by orders, is preparing for its IPO. The company has achieved significant growth by focusing on value shoppers in smaller Indian towns. Despite this success, Meesho continues to report substantial losses. Investors are weighing these losses against the company's strong market position and future growth potential.

items.title: Speb Adhesives IPO sees tepid demand on Day 1, issue subscribed 6% so far. Check GMP, key details, more
items.summary: Speb Adhesives IPO opened on December 1, targeting  ₹52 to  ₹56 per share. It offers a minimum bid of 4,000 shares for retail investors. Proceeds will fund a new plant in Raigad, enhancing water-based adhesive production capacity.

items.title: Lenskart share price hits fresh peak after strong Q2 show; Jefferies bullish with THIS target
items.summary: Lenskart Share Price: Jefferies initiated coverage with a Buy rating and a target price of Rs 500. The brokerage said Q2 marks the beginning of Lenskart’s compounding phase driven by operating leverage from technology and supply chain improvements.

items.title: India's manufacturing sector activity falls to 9-month low in November on softer rise in sales, production: PMI
items.summary: The seasonally adjusted HSBC India Manufacturing Purchasing Managers’ Index (PMI) fell from 59.2 in October to 56.6 in November, highlighting the slowest improvement in operating conditions since February

items.title: SBI predicts credit growth rebound as working capital demand rises
items.summary: Companies across various sectors have begun increasing their working capital utilization, an early sign of strengthening loan demand. Historical evidence suggests that IPO collections and overall credit growth do not have a one-to-one relationship. Significantly, years with elevated IPO collections have often coincided with slower lending growth.

items.title: Force Motors: This multibagger auto stock turns  ₹1 lakh into  ₹81 lakh in 12 years
items.summary: Force Motors has delivered exceptional returns to investors, with a 164% increase in shares over the last year. The company, known for its diverse automotive range, has consistently shown growth, achieving an 8,000% rise since 2013 and reaching an all-time high of  ₹21,999.

items.summary: MIC Electronics' stock rose nearly 7% after securing a contract from the Vijayawada Railway Division for an Integrated Passenger Information System. The project, valued at  ₹1.49 crore, will be completed in 12 months, enhancing digital communication in Indian Railways.

items.title: Mega PSU bank merger plan: Can India do it without amplifying risks?
items.summary: India plans new PSB mergers to create global-sized banks to fund major projects. Success depends on balancing scale against the heightened systemic risk of concentrated power.

items.title: Google's AI chip push spurs hope for Samsung, SK Hynix
items.summary: As Google emerges as a formidable new force in the artificial intelligence hardware space with its tensor processing units, expectations are rising that surging demand for high-bandwidth memory could benefit South Korean semiconductor giants such as Samsung Electronics and SK hynix, as per a report by The Korea Herald.

items.title: Central Excise (Amendment) Bill, 2025: Govt tables bill for new levies on cigarettes, pan masala and gutkha
items.summary: FM Sitharaman introduces Health Security National Cess Bill 2025 to replace GST compensation cess on tobacco products, including cigarettes, pan masala, and gutkha, while amending the Central Excise Act to maintain or raise tobacco duties. The move aims to fund national security and public health.

items.title: India seeks parliament's nod for Rs 1.32 lakh crore in extra spending for this fiscal year
items.summary: India has asked for parliament's approval for an additional 1.32 lakh crore rupees ($14.61 billion) in additional spending for the fiscal year concluding March 31, 2026. The exact net increase in government expenditure remains unclear.

items.summary: The stock has gained significant momentum from its March low of ₹651.50, more than doubling in value over the past nine months

items.title: RBI likely steps in to support rupee as it sinks to record low: Traders
items.summary: The Indian rupee hit a record low against the U.S. dollar on Monday, falling to 89.7575 and nearing the 90 level. Traders reported that the central bank likely intervened to support the currency, with one describing the intervention as "mild for now".

items.title: Silver soars to record Rs 1,78,649. What powered the rally and how close is Rs 2 lakh target?
items.summary: Silver futures on MCX hit a new record on Monday, with March 2026 contracts touching ₹1,78,649 per kg. The surge follows strong recent momentum and aligns with global gains driven by Fed rate-cut expectations, dollar weakness, and rising safe-haven demand.

items.title: Mahindra posts 22% rise in November SUV sales
items.summary: The boost in November sales of SUVs were driven by continued demand boost from tax cuts

items.title: Clear Secured IPO day 1: GMP, subscription status, price band, other details of NSE SME IPO
items.summary: Clear Secured IPO day 1: The Clear Secured Services IPO opened on December 1, aiming to raise  ₹85.60 crore. With a tepid response in subscriptions and a modest grey market premium of  ₹10, the IPO details, including price band and allotment schedule, reveal a cautious investor sentiment.

items.title: The geopolitics of rare-earth magnets: India needs a wide-angle approach to satisfy growing demand
items.summary: India can now produce some critical rare-earth metals, but reliance on China for advanced magnets exposes a structural vulnerability. With supply chains getting weaponized, the Centre has unveiled a new scheme. Our strategy, however, may need to both broaden and sharpen.

items.title: Maruti Suzuki India merges with wholly-owned subsidiary Suzuki Motor Gujarat
items.summary: Maruti Suzuki India announced that its amalgamation scheme with Suzuki Motor Gujarat has become effective from December 1, 2025. This move increases the company's authorized share capital by Rs 15,000 crore. The appointed date for the amalgamation was April 1, 2025, marking the completion of the merger.

items.title: Small-cap stock under  ₹50: IT share rises 4% after this endorsement update
items.summary: Blue Cloud Softech Solutions share price rose by 4% after announcing its AI healthcare expansion to 56 Commonwealth nations, targeting a market worth $957.30 bln. The initiative aims to enhance accessible healthcare across various regions, supported by endorsements from major medical associations.

items.title: Gold vs Silver: Which precious metal should you buy as Silver prices hit record high
items.summary: Precious metals saw significant gains in November, with gold rising over 5.5% and silver soaring 21.71%. Year-to-date, gold is up 65% and silver over 100%, driven by a weaker U.S. dollar and supply constraints. Analysts recommend gold for stability and caution with silver investments.

items.title: Lupin gets USFDA nod for biosimilar drug
items.summary: Lupin gets USFDA approval for Armlupeg, a biosimilar to Neulasta, to treat neutropenia in cancer patients. The drug will be manufactured at Lupin’s Pune facility. Armlupeg aims to reduce infection risk from chemotherapy, and Lupin plans to expand its US biosimilar portfolio. The US market for Pegfilgrastim is worth over $1.29 billion annually.

items.title: Sun Pharma launches plaque psoriasis drug ILUMYA in India
items.summary: A novel biologic treatment, ILUMYA (Tildrakizumab) has been endorsed widely by dermatologists in the US and worldwide for several years as an effective and safe treatment of moderate to severe plaque psoriasis

items.title: Banking sakhis have revolutionized access to financial services in rural India: Let’s strengthen this network
items.summary: The banking correspondent network of sakhis has shown the wonders of doorstep banking in rural India. The next stage of success will depend on strengthening their network through various means, including better training, infrastructure and institutional support.

items.title: Mehli Mistry resigns from Ratan Tata’s cherished project Small Animal Hospital
items.summary: A few hours after Mistry’s resignation, a second trustee of Small Animal Hospital Trust, Dr Anirudh Kohli, CEO, Breach Candy Hospital Trust, also resigned.

items.title: 2026 Oil Outlook: Will OPEC+ cut again to support prices?
items.summary: OPEC+ is expected to stay cautious in 2026 as sanctioned supply, peace talks, and uncertain inventories cloud the global oil outlook and may prompt further output cuts to support prices.

items.title: Japanese property giants deepen their push into a booming Indian market
items.summary: Japanese real estate developers are increasing their investments in India's growing property market, attracted by rising rents and low construction costs. Companies like Mitsui Fudosan and Sumitomo Realty are actively pursuing new office, retail, and hotel projects, embracing development risks that offer higher returns than their domestic markets.

items.title: Paytm share price rallies over 3%, reaches highest level since December 2021
items.summary: One 97 Communications shares rose 3.4% to  ₹1,365, the highest since December 2021. Easing regulatory issues and positive earnings have driven an 18% rally over two months, with Goldman Sachs upgrading its target price sharply, forecasting 20-25% annual revenue growth over the next few years.

items.title: IPOs in December: Meesho, ICICI Prudential to Wakefit — 12 public offers worth  ₹40,000 crore set to open this month
items.summary: With three IPOs — namely Meesho, Aequs and Vidya Wire — set to open this week, the total funds raised from the primary market will swell to the highest ever, easily surpassing the  ₹1,59,783.76 crore fundraise seen in 2024.

items.title: KK Silk Mills IPO allotment date likely today. GMP, steps to check share allotment status online
items.summary: KK Silk Mills' IPO experienced strong demand, closing its subscription on November 28. The allotment date is expected today, December 1, with shares listing on the BSE SME platform on December 3. Investors can check their allotment status online.

items.title: SWREL bags Rs 1,400 crore order from Adani Green Energy in Gujarat
items.summary: Sterling and Wilson Renewable Energy has won a significant order worth around Rs 1,400 crore from Adani Green Energy in Gujarat. This marks their first purchase order from Adani Green.

items.title: India weighs Mongolian coking coal imports despite transport hurdles, source says
items.summary: India is exploring importing coking coal from Mongolia to diversify supplies, despite transport and geopolitical challenges. Currently reliant on Australia for over half its coal, India faces rising demand and is evaluating Mongolia’s high-grade, lower-cost coal via Russia or China routes, though logistics and potential Chinese restrictions pose hurdles.

items.title: Rupee hits record low of 89.73 vs USD amid weak flows, trade deal woes
items.summary: The Indian rupee hit a new low against the dollar, despite strong economic growth figures. Unfavorable trade and portfolio flows, coupled with the absence of a U.S.-India trade deal, are pressuring the currency.  Economists suggest a "calibrated" depreciation is necessary to offset these challenges, as foreign investors continue to withdraw funds from equities.

items.title: Commodity playbook: How treasury reopening, firm dollar, and Fed signals are shaping the road ahead
items.summary: Global commodities face heightened volatility as the US Treasury’s reopening, a firm dollar, and uncertain Fed rate-cut timing shape price trends. Strong yields and dollar strength are pressuring crude, gold, and base metals, while potential 2026 rate cuts and easing geopolitical risks could revive demand across key commodity segments.

items.title: Sun Pharma brings global psoriasis drug ILUMYA to Indian market
items.summary: Sun Pharmaceutical Industries has launched its innovative biologic drug, ILUMYA, in India for moderate-to-severe plaque psoriasis. This novel treatment, Tildrakizumab, has a proven track record globally for providing significant and sustained skin clearance.

items.title: Paytm shares jump over 3%, extending fourth straight day of gains. Here's why
items.summary: Paytm shares rose sharply on Monday, extending their fourth straight session of gains after One97 Communications announced full ownership of three key group companies.  One97 Communications has secured full ownership of Foster Payment Networks, Paytm Insuretech and PFSL by acquiring the remaining 9.99%, 67.55% and 51.22% stakes. With this, all three firms are now wholly owned subsidiaries.

items.title: Credit growth to rebound as IPO liquidity spent and working capital demand rises: SBI
items.summary: The credit growth of the banks in the country which had slowed in recent quarters, is expected to pick up as companies begin to draw more funds for their day-to-day operations, highlighted a report by State Bank of India.

items.title: India's factory growth slows to nine-month low as US tariffs dent demand, PMI shows
items.summary: India's manufacturing sector experienced a slowdown in November. Growth reached a nine-month low. This deceleration was attributed to stiff U.S. tariffs affecting demand. Factory output and new orders expanded at their weakest pace since February. International demand also sputtered.

items.title: Aequs IPO GMP surges to 35% ahead of launch on December 3; check issue size and other key details inside
items.summary: Aequs will open its Rs 921.81-crore IPO on December 3, with grey market premiums surging to about 35%, indicating strong investor appetite. Priced at Rs 118–124 per share, the issue includes a fresh offering and OFS. Despite widening losses, pre-IPO institutional interest and strong aerospace manufacturing capabilities support sentiment.

items.title: India orders mobile phones preloaded with government app to ensure cyber safety
items.summary: India’s telecom ministry has ordered all smartphone manufacturers to pre-install its cyber-security app, Sanchar Saathi, on all new devices within 90 days, and to push it to existing phones via software updates. Users will not be able to disable the app. The directive is expected to create friction with Apple, whose policies forbid pre-installing government or third-party apps.

items.title: Meesho IPO: How the women-powered platform left Amazon and Flipkart chasing discounts
items.summary: Meesho has emerged as India’s largest e-commerce marketplace by tapping millions of value-conscious shoppers in small towns. Built on low prices, unbranded goods and a zero-commission model, it now dominates non-metro India, driving massive user and order growth while Amazon and Flipkart race to catch up in the hinterland.

items.title: Broader upside ahead; midcaps, NBFCs and autos to lead next market leg: Nirav Sheth

Broader markets, NBFCs, autos and cement are poised to lead the next leg of the rally, while strong IPO flows signal a healthy market. GST cuts, easing rates and rising credit growth are expected to drive momentum in 2026.

items.title: India bonds fall as doubts over rate cut grows ahead of RBI meet
items.summary: Indian government bonds saw a decline on Monday. Traders adjusted positions ahead of the Reserve Bank of India's policy decision. Stronger-than-expected economic growth data for the July-September quarter has clouded the outlook for interest rate reductions. The benchmark 10-year yield increased. Market participants are now debating the timing of the next rate cut.

items.title: US equity markets: Largecaps stay strong, smallcaps eye alpha opportunities, says Vincent Nichols
items.summary: Strategist Vincent Nichols sees smallcaps as a strong complement to largecap tech, potentially adding alpha as interest rate cuts continue. Nichols also noted that while tech capex is strong, a digestion period is likely in the medium term.

items.title: Mahindra sales up 19 per cent YoY in November

This positive trend, with around 80% of their SUVs falling into the taxed category, highlights the impact of government measures to stimulate the automotive market.  Other major players are yet to release their figures.

items.title: Massive hike in user fee at Delhi and Mumbai Airports
items.summary: Passengers at Delhi and Mumbai airports face significantly higher user charges. A TDSAT order redefines tariff calculations, leading to a potential 22-fold surge. This could increase ticket prices substantially. The Airports Economic Regulatory Authority and airlines have challenged the order in the Supreme Court. The dispute stems from airport privatisation and asset valuation.

items.title: Lupin Pharma, TPG Capital & EQT in talks to acquire Lalvani family-owned Vitabiotics
items.summary: Indian drugmaker Lupin and private equity firms are exploring the acquisition of UK's Vitabiotics. The deal is valued at approximately one billion pounds. Several Indian companies had previously considered the acquisition but stepped back due to valuation concerns. Vitabiotics' Indian arm, Meyer Vitabiotics, contributes significantly to its annual sales. The nutraceutical market in India is experiencing rapid growth.

items.title: ED accuses Experion Developers of misusing IBC rules in land deal
items.summary: The Enforcement Directorate has accused Experion Developers of misusing the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code. The agency claims Experion improperly acquired land in Gurugram's Sector 62. Experion allegedly manipulated the committee of creditors to approve a resolution plan. The ED has asked the National Company Law Tribunal to recall its order. Experion denies the allegations, stating debt assignments were legitimate.

items.title: Music companies bet on short formats, AI to hit the right note
items.summary: Indian music labels are embracing short-form video platforms and generative AI. They see these as key drivers for future revenue growth. Labels are also exploring new ways to monetize content. This strategic shift aims to capture new audiences and boost earnings in the evolving music industry.

items.title: India-Russia ties: Putin's visit sparks $100bln trade ambitions amidst global tensions
items.summary: India and Russia are set to significantly boost trade and investment. A major business forum will be held in New Delhi, coinciding with President Putin's visit. Both nations aim for $100 billion in bilateral trade by 2030. The focus will be on expanding Indian engineering and food product exports to Russia.

items.title: PNGRB expert panel for sweeping reform to unlock free gas market
items.summary: A high-level committee has urged sweeping reforms for a free, competitive natural gas market in India, essential for the nation's clean energy transition. The report advocates for market-driven pricing, open access, and a neutral Independent System Operator to enhance transparency, attract investment, and improve resource allocation.

items.title: Budget wishlist: Green finance institute among CII proposals
items.summary: The Confederation of Indian Industry suggests a Green Finance Institution to fund India's green transition. It also proposes a National Digitalisation of Built Environment Initiative. These plans aim to support renewable energy, clean mobility, and industrial decarbonisation. The proposals address the significant need for green investments to achieve net-zero emissions by 2070.

items.title: India critical growth engine for CapitaLand to double FUM ,evaluating India REIT: Kishore Moorjani
items.summary: CapitaLand Investment is gearing up for significant expansion in India, aiming to double its funds under management. The company is focusing on its core strengths in business parks, logistics, and data centers, with plans to leverage forward-purchase deals, development, and selective acquisitions. An India REIT is also under active consideration as a future milestone.

items.title: Private companies may get to service non-railway entities' wagons
items.summary: Indian Railways is exploring a plan to permit private companies to maintain freight wagons. This move aims to address capacity issues in overhaul depots and create new service opportunities. Private wagon owners could service their own containers. This initiative is expected to improve efficiency and reduce maintenance delays for the railway network.

items.title: Xiaomi rejigs mid-level roles to spur growth
items.summary: Xiaomi is restructuring its Indian operations, empowering mid-level executives and consolidating functions under its top three leaders. This strategic move aims to aggressively push into the premium segment and reclaim market share, with a focus on boosting online business growth while supporting the thriving offline segment.

items.title: All eyes on tariffs as bill for opening up nuclear power to be tabled this Parliament  session
items.summary: India's nuclear power sector is opening to private companies and state governments. The Atomic Energy Bill 2025, set for Parliament, will address tariff determination. This crucial policy decision will shape the industry. Overseas technology providers may find it easier to participate. The government aims to bridge a regulatory gap in tariff setting for nuclear plants.

items.title: Public banks take a leap in personal loan origination
items.summary: Public sector banks are now originating more unsecured personal loans. They focused on larger loan amounts, especially over Rs 10 lakh. This shift occurred as banks had extra money and sought higher returns. Non-banking finance companies still lead in small loans but saw their share decrease. Private banks also experienced a slight decline in their origination share.

items.title: CII suggests green finance institution, green tech expo fund for FY27 Budget
items.summary: The industry body emphasized the urgent need for an estimated $1 trillion in green investments over the next 10-15 years, highlighting that current finance flows cover only about 25% of this requirement.

The market shows sustained momentum with a preference for larger, premium homes despite rising prices.

This decision follows a robust 8.2% GDP growth reported for the July-September quarter. Expectations for a rate cut have diminished. The RBI previously kept the repo rate steady at 5.5% in October, citing moderated inflation.

The platform continues its upward trajectory, solidifying its role in the nation's payment ecosystem.

Experts warn of further erosion of trade volumes in the coming year.

Benchmark stock indices Sensex and Nifty closed almost unchanged in a highly volatile trade on Friday as investors stayed on the sidelines ahead of key macroeconomic data announcements in post-market hours.

Halting its two-day rally, the 30-share BSE Sensex slipped by 13.71 points or 0.02 per cent to settle at 85,706.67. During the day, it hit a high of 85,969.89 and a low of 85,577.82, gyrating 392.07 points.

The 50-share NSE Nifty skidded 12.60 points or 0.05 per cent to 26,202.95.

items.summary: Asian Paints, SBI, Tata Motors, HUL and Maruti Suzuki are top gainers while ONGC, Axis Bank, MM, Bajaj Auto and Hero MotoCorp are major losers in the Sensex.

items.title: Uber  redBus partner with ixigo for train travellers
items.summary: ixigo, India’s leading mobile travel marketplace has announced partnerships with Uber and redBus to enable instant bookings for cabs and buses natively within ixigo trains app.

items.title: Workload in IT to come down due to AI; jobs to reduce: Genpact
items.summary: But along with that the employment growth rates have started to dip, NV 'Tiger' Tyagarajan says. The percentage addition of employees in India will not be same as past. And due to advancements, a workforce with higher skill sets is required for the IT industry, he says.

items.title: Pixel launch: Is Google Assistant's AI an assault on privacy?
items.summary: Sure, artificial intelligence can make life simpler by suggesting you places to eat, tell you weather, or even crack a joke.  The more you use it, the more it learns about your habits and preferences. The protocols pertaining to artificial intelligence, or the lack of it, make our data less secure and more vulnerable.

items.title: Up over 200% in 1 year, what's buzzing with Borosil Glass?
items.summary: Shares of Borosil Glass Works have increased threefold over the past one year as the company has posted strong revenue and EBIDTA growth over the past few quarters.

items.title: Why you should not be always chasing returns
items.summary: Most people focus on returns and chase products that offer the best returns at any point.

items.title: Jhunjhunwala-partnered fund buys stake in TFCI: What's buzzing?
items.summary: In an interview with CNBC-TV18, Satpal Arora, MD of Tourism Finance Corporation of India (TFCI), talked about the state of business and the outlook ahead.

items.title: RBI latest meeting 'diluted' its old policy framework: Nomura
items.summary: On Tuesday, the central bank surprised the market with a 25-basis-point cut to its policy repo rate, or the rate at which it lends to banks, to 6.25 percent.

items.title: Bond bull market may pause but is far from over: Expert
items.summary: The benchmark 10-year government-security yield remained stuck in 8-7.5 percent range through all of 2015 and half of 2016, moving lower to sub-7 percent only when the RBI promised in April to reduce the system's liquidity deficit. The yield may now fall more.

items.title: Scope for meaningful rate cuts going ahead: Neelkanth Mishra
items.summary: Credit Suisse' Neelkanth Mishra expects repo rate to fall to a decade low in the coming quarters. He says that beginning December the market may see a robust and widespread pick-up which may boost indices.

items.title: Tech up to a healthier world
items.summary: Sensors, 3D printed skin, wearables, reconstructed organs, revolutionized clinical trials, personalized medicine and what not – get ready for a new era of healthcare

items.title: Steel stocks rally as govt extends MIP on 66 steel products
items.summary: Stocks like Hindustan Zinc, Hindalco, Jindal Steel, JSW Steel and Tata Steel gained over 1 percent from previous close.

items.title: Endurance Technologies IPO opens: Should you subscribe?
items.summary: The Aurangabad-based company aims to mop up nearly Rs 1,162 crore (at higher end of price band) by diluting 17.5 percent stake through the issue that will close on October 7. It already raised Rs 348.52 crore through anchor investors' portion on Tuesday, the day before issue opening.

items.title: Cautiously optimistic on India; eyeing earnings revival: Sanger
items.summary: Global liquidity tailwinds are unlikely to get any better from now and that makes Arvind Sanger, Managing Partner at Geosphere Capital Management “cautiously optimistic” on the Indian markets.

items.title: Automation threatens 69% jobs in India: World Bank
items.summary: "In large parts of Africa, it is likely that technology could fundamentally disrupt this pattern. Research based on World Bank data has predicted that the proportion of jobs threatened in India by automation is 69 percent, in China it is 77 percent and in Ethiopia, the percentage of jobs threatened by automation is 85 percent," he said.
